intro: Vangueria edulis, commonly known as the sour fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by edible, yellowish-orange fruits. The fruits are typically consumed raw or cooked and have a tangy, acidic flavor. It is often grown for its ornamental value and as a source of food in local communities.
